overview_of_class:
Topic: Super Hero Plays.

According to Wikipedia, a superhero is a costumed heroic character who possesses supernatural or superhuman powers and who is dedicated to fighting crime, protecting the public, and battling supervillains. In this course, writers will explore the traditional superhero formula, and consider what less mystical behaviors might be considered "heroic" in society today, and craft short plays of their own.

Instructor permission required.
Meets Wednesdays, 12-2:50pm Professor: Laura Schellhardt
name: Playwriting II Genres
title: SoC THEATRE 336-0-20 Playwriting II Genres

subject: THEATRE

overview_of_class:
Topic: I LOVE YOU.

Love is, of course, many things to many people. It's an action. A feeling. A sacrifice. A gift. It's complicated. In this course, writers will create one-act plays about love in which no character says the words "I love you."

Instructor permission required.
Meets Thursdays, 3-5:50pm Professor: Julie Marie Myatt
name: Playwriting II Genres
